resources.string:
Hello there. This here is a practice app I have made to better understand Android app development. It has been a long, difficult process, but I have finally did it! 

This Main Menu page is a demonstration on how I can implement a scroll view. In it, how it uses the 'contentBody' style is different from a non-scrollable body style I have done for a separate page (that being page 3). 

The second page is a demonstration of how I can utilise clickable tabs inside a drawer layout application (which is what this app is built from as a default). 

The third page is a demonstration of a basic non-scrollable page consisting of only one paragraph. 

The fourth page is where I put a form. Upon form submission, the user will be redirected to a page, showing the form input values that the user has typed in. From there, the user can either go back to the form or to the main menu page. 

The fifth page is where I read from a JSON file and output in the form of a list (for example holidays, which I shamelessly used for a failed technical test for an employer). The user can press a button to redirect to a page showing full details. 

That is all there is to this app. I may possibly add more to this, such as usage of APIs, translating JSON text values depending on the phone's country of origin, justifying text paragraphs e.t.c.
